newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain - Corn rises but soy, wheat flat.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain - Corn rises but soy, wheat flat.

text.p: CHICAGO, Sept 16 - FOB Gulf basis values for corn rose on Monday in almost all the positions while soybean and wheat positions were steady.
Slow movement, lower CBOT corn prices and lackluster export activity contributed to higher corn values, dealers said.

In export news, Egypt bought 450,000 tonnes of French wheat and USDA's Commodity Credit Corp seeks up to 42,000 tonnes of U.S. No. 2 or better hard red winter wheat under the export donation program to Georgia. The shipment period is October 10-November 5 and offers are due by September 23.
Dealers quoted the following afternoon FOB U.S. Gulf values, basis Chicago futures, except hard red winter wheat basis Kansas City. (In cents per bushel).
No. 3 yellow corn -
September 15-30 - no bid, 50 ov Dec offered
October 1-20 - no bid, 47 ov Dec offered
October 12-31 - no bid, 43 ov Dec offered
November 1-20 - no bid, 39 ov Dec offered
November 11-30 - no bid, 39 ov Dec offered
December 1-20 - no bid, 39 ov Dec offered
December 12-31 - no bid, 39 ov Dec offered
